title: Former Angels Executive Found Guilty in Tyler Skaggs Case
sub_head: Jury convicts Eric Kay of supplying the drugs that killed the pitcher in 2019
body:
Former Los Angeles Angels communications executive Eric Kay was found guilty on Thursday of supplying the opioid drugs that killed Tyler Skaggs, a pitcher on the team, in 2019.
After a deliberation of less than 90 minutes, a federal jury in Fort Worth, Texas, convicted Kay on two felony charges: providing Skaggs with counterfeit oxycodone pills laced with fentanyl that resulted in his death and conspiracy to possess with intent to distribute.
